text: The Jaunpur Sultanate () was a late medieval Indian Muslim state that ruled from the northern Indian areas to southern Nepal. ==History== It was founded by Malik Sarwar, an eunuch slave who was succeeded by his adoptive son, an Indian Muslim. It was founded in 1394 and had six Sultans till 1493 when it was absorbed by the Lodi dynastyâ€™s king Bahlul Lodi. ==Territory== File:Map of the Sharqi Dynasty of the Jaunpur Sultanate.png ==References== Category:14th-century disestablishments in Asia Category:14th century in India Category:Dynasties in India
title: Jaunpur Sultanate
